medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe hypertriglyceridemia and acquired generalized lipoatrophy
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first presented at age 12 years with eruptive xanthomas and a blood triglyceride level of 181 mmol/liter. The patient's facial fat decreased progressively from infancy until the time of presentation. Symptoms of hypertriglyceridemia, including blood lipid levels, hepatomegaly, and painful xanthomas, progressed from ages 14 to 15 years, leading to the referral for evaluation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Refractory hypertriglyceridemia; amenorrhea after age 14; normal developmental milestones; history of food intolerance and difficulty adhering to a low fat diet.
